metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3177 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Python 3.x through 3.9.1 has a buffer overflow in PyCArg_repr in_ctypes/callproc.c, which may lead to remote code execution in certainPython applications that accept floating-point numbers as untrusted input,as demonstrated by a 1e300 argument to c_double.from_param. This occursbecause sprintf is used unsafely.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-4
libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-4
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-4
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-4
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-4
python2.7 - 2.7.18-4
python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-4
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.18-4').
